person violating this section is guilty of a misdemeanor and is punishable in accordance with section 676 set forth hereafter     viii 1162018 dangerous dogdetermination by police chief a the chief of police or designee may without a public hearing and based on the facts available to him or her declare a dog to be dangerous or potentially dangerous based on any one of the following guidelines 1 the nature of any attack committed or wound inflicted by the animal and the need to put the community and owner on notice that the dog has displayed the propensity to inflict wounds or engage in aggressive or menacing behavior  andor 2 the past history and seriousness of any attacks or wounds inflicted by the animal  andor 3 the dog has exhibited an aggressive and vicious propensity toward persons or domestic animals and is capable of inflicting serious physical harm or death or damage to property  andor 4 the conditions under which the animal is kept and maintained which could contribute to encourage or facilitate aggressive behavior such as but not limited to allowing the animal to run at large tethering in excess of legal limits as defined in this chapter physical property conditions presence of young children the elderly or infirm within or residing near the home any past violations of this chapter andor failing to provide proper care food shelter or water  andor 5 whether the dog was owned or harbored primarily or in part for the purpose of dog fighting or any dog trained for dog fighting  6 in determining whether to deem a dog dangerous the factfinder may consider potentially mitigating circumstances such as whether the bite or scratch was made in a playful manner without any sign of aggression or whether it was a response to pain abuse criminal trespass and intentional provocation b if a dog is deemed dangerous or potentially dangerous the level shall be specified as potentially dangerous or dangerous level 1 2 or 3 based on the nature of the attack or wound combined with the totality of circumstances the guidelines per level are advisory in nature and shall not bind the factfinder to a particular level if the totality of circumstances warrants a higher or lower level 1 potentially dangerous  a minor bite nip scratch or abrasion where skin contact or nicks may be evident but no vertical puncture wound exists  or an attack without an actual bite which inhibits movement andor otherwise qualifies as an attack pursuant to section 61 2 dangerous level 1  any attack as defined by section 61 or bite in an aggressive manner that pierces the skin  or any attack or bite subsequent to being deemed dangerous or potentially dangerous on a prior occasion 3 dangerous level 2  any bite that requires medical attention  or any bite that includes deep punctures or bruising even when no medical attention is sought  or any attack or bite incident involving predatory aggressive behavior toward a human or other domesticated animal while running at large including but not limited to chasing stalking circling inhibiting movement predatory or aggressive pack behavior  or any bite subsequent to being deemed dangerous or potentially dangerous on a prior occasion 4 dangerous level 3  any severe bite to a human requiring significant medical attention wound closure or other emergency medical attention  or an attack or bite with a demonstrated history of bites or attacks  or repeated noncompliance with animal ordinances or requirements of animal control that indicates a risk to the public  or circumstances otherwise indicating a pronounced and obvious risk to public health or safety c if a dog is deemed dangerous or potentially dangerous the conditions may be required of the dogs owner or harborer to guarantee the safety of the public including but not limited to attendance at an approved education course canine aggression workshop or management plan sterilization liability insurance or safety equipment d the following conditions are minimum requirements that shall be ordered at each level 1 potentially dangerous requirements  mandatory signage and registration in accordance with sections 6702 6703 6705 and microchipping pursuant to section 6705 if there are no further incidents or indications of aggression either charged in court or uncharged and all requirements have been met upon application by the owner to the chief of police the potentially dangerous dog designation and all restrictions that accompany it may be removed after 24 months the decision to lift the designation is at the discretion of the chief of police or designee 2 level 1 and level 2  mandatory secure enclosure as specified in section 6701 mandatory signage and registration in accordance with sections 6702 and 6703 microchipping pursuant to section 6705 and a letter from a landlord if one exists if there are no further incidents or indications of aggression either charged in court or uncharged and all requirements have been met upon application by the owner to the chief of police the level 1 dangerous dog designation and all restrictions that accompany it may be removed after 36 months the decision to lift the designation is at the discretion of the police chief or designee the designation may never be removed from a level 2 determination 3 level 3  euthanasia is mandatory but shall not take place until appeal time has expired or been waived or an appeal if initiated has been concluded e a dog that is harbored or maintained outside the city limits of wellington but committed acts within the city limits of wellington that would deem it dangerous or potentially dangerous may be deemed dangerous and any orders made pursuant to that determination will apply if the dog enters the city limits of wellington f determination of dangerous dognotification procedure  if the chief of police or a designee determines that a dog is dangerous or potentially dangerous he or she will determine an appropriate disposition based on the known facts and consistent with the provisions of this chapter the chief of police or a designee may impound the dog and shall notify the owner of such determination and right to appeal by personal service residential service at the persons usual place of abode by leaving a copy of the notice with some person of suitable age and discretion residing therein or by certified mail addressed to the owners last known address or addressed to the location where the dog is maintained if the owner is not the owner of the residence where the animal is located the chief of police or a designee shall notify the landowner of record by mailing first class mail of the determination at the address on file with the register of deeds or county treasurer if service is by certified mail wellington police department shall request return receipt with instructions to the delivering postal employee to show to whom delivered the date of delivery and address where delivered service of process by certified mail shall be considered obtained upon the delivery if the certified mail envelope is returned with an endorsement showing refusal of delivery the chief of police or designee shall send a copy of the notice to the defendant by ordinary first class mail this first class mailing shall be evidenced by a certificate of mailing service shall be considered obtained upon the mailing of this additional notice by first class mail g dangerous or potentially dangerous dogappeal of decision of police chief  the owner of a dog declared dangerous or potentially dangerous by the chief of police or a designee may appeal the determination by filing a form provided by the city of wellington municipal court within 14 calendar days of receipt of such notification the completed form shall be submitted to the city of wellington municipal court and a municipal judge will conduct an administrative hearing with seven calendar days of receipt of the owners appeal unless good cause requires an extension of hearing date at such hearing testimony may be offered by the owner of the dog animal trainers who have directly and personally evaluated the dog wellington police officers or staff victims of any bite or attack witnesses to the dogs behavior neighbors or other affected persons and veterinarians concerning the vicious propensity of the dog the municipal court judge shall consider the factors listed in section 670 and by applying substantial competent evidence shall either deem the dog potentially dangerous or dangerous and assign a level or shall overrule the dangerous or potentially dangerous determination made by the chief of police the municipal court will notify the owner in writing of the outcome of the hearing within five business days h costs of care at all phases of appeal  during all stages of any appeal process the owner keeper or harborer of such animal shall be responsible for the cost of keeping such animal in the animal shelter the owner keeper or harborer of such animal can file a renewable nonrefundable cash or performance bond with the municipal court within the appeal period in an amount equal to the cost of care and treatment of the animal for 20 days said cash or performance bond shall be renewable for an additional 20 days and each successive 20 days the animal is held by the city of wellington during the pendency of the appeal payment of said renewal shall be within five days of the running of the previous 20 day period if said cash or performance bond or its renewal is not tendered to the municipal court within the time specified above then city of wellington shall have immediate ownership of such animal and the chief of police shall determine the disposition of such animal absent such appeal the chief of police or designee may pick up and cause the animal to be destroyed or in lieu of such destruction he or she may permit the confinement of the animal in a manner and location that he or she deems appropriate or as provided in section 670 i appeal from the decisions of municipal court judge  after a municipal court judge conducts an administrative hearing and rules based on the substantial competent facts the municipal court will notify the owner in writing of the outcome of the hearing within five business days the owner may appeal the hearing outcome to the district court of sumner county within 14 days of the written notification the district court will reviews the case to determine if the municipal court judges decision was supported by substantial evidence and that the administrative order was neither arbitrary nor capricious in accordance with ksa 602101      6272006  iviii 712008  i 12182012  ix 1162018   dangerous dogfailure to comply with orders a it is person engaged in committing an act of violence robbery theft or other crime upon the property b for purposes of this section the word permit shall mean allow or let happen knowledge or intention on it shall be unlawful to by words sign or otherwise set any dog to fight or cause any dog to attack any other dog or aid or abet or encourage any dog fight  or for any owner keeper or harborer of any dog to knowingly permit such dog to fight without endeavoring to prevent the same  or for any person to by words sign or otherwise set on or encourage any dog to attack or chase any human being not engaged in malicious or criminal acts 1 unlawful conduct of dogfighting is a causing for amusement or gain any dog to fight with or injure another dog  b knowingly permitting such fighting or injuring on premises under ones ownership charge or control  or c training owning keeping transporting or selling any dog for the purpose or with the intent of having it fight with or injure another dog 2 harborer it shall be unlawful to keep a dog tethered in place for more than two hours at a time after a break of not less than two hours off the tether a dog may be tethered again for two hours a dog may not be tethered more than four hours in any 24hour period b conditions of tethering are defined as follows 1 dogs shall be tethered in such a manner as to prevent injury strangulation or entanglement on fences trees or other objects 2 any chain or tether must be attached to a properly fitting collar or to a harness that is worn by the dog collars shall not be of a choke type 3 no tether shall weigh more than oneeighth of the dogs body weight 4 any tether shall be at least ten feet in length and have swivels on both ends 5 any tethering system used shall not allow the dog to leave the owners property c exceptions to tethering are as follows overhead trolley tethering systems are allowed and not applicable to the provisions of subsection a of this section d penalties for violation of this section are as follows 1 a violation of this section shall be an unclassified misdemeanor upon repeat offenses by the same person the court shall have the discretion to remove the dog involved and place the animals with the county humane society for adoption 2 any dog found to be tethered in violation of this section may at the discretion of the animal control officer be impounded and placed in a safe harbor until ordered by the court to be released the owner of the impounded dog shall be responsible for any costs associated with the dogs placement if the owner fails to pay the impound costs the subject dog may be considered for adoption county humane society iv 4152008 dog shelters should be amended to include the following 1 dog pens all dogs are to be confined to the owners property and not allowed to run free confinement can be met by adequately fenced yard and in situations where the yard is not fenced  the owner shall confine the dog to the home or an adequate outside enclosure such enclosure shall be constructed of chain link or other suitable materials with all four sides enclosed the enclosure shall be of sufficient height to prevent the dog from escaping from the enclosure the top of the enclosure shall be covered with materials to provide the dog with shade and protection from the elements the enclosure shall be adequate square footage to provide adequate exercise for the size of the dog confined 2 cleanliness generally it shall be unlawful for any person to keep or maintain any animal in any yard structure or area that is not clean dry and sanitary free from debris and offensive odors that annoy any neighbor and devoid of rodents and vermin 3 removal of excrement excrement shall be removed at least once each week from any animal shelter pen or yard area where animals are kept or more often if necessary to prevent or control odors fly breeding or rodent infestation if excrement is stored on the premises by any animal owner it shall be stored in adequate containers with fly tight lids and all such stored or accumulated wastes shall be disposed of at least once each week 4 drainage all animal shelters pens and yards shall be so located that adequate drainage is obtained normal drying occurs and standing water is not present 5 maintenance all animal shelters and fences confining animals shall be maintained in good repair and all animal shelters and fences confining animals subject to residential and commercial classification shall be protected from deterioration by painting or comparable treatment 6 inspection all premises on which animals are kept shall be subject to inspection by any animal control officer duly authorized law enforcement officer or public health official if the officer or official determines from such inspection that the premises are not being maintained in a clean and sanitary manner he shall notify the owner of the animal in writing to correct the sanitation deficiencies within 24 hours after notice is served on the owner any animal kept under any condition which could endanger the public or animal health or create a health nuisance may be impounded animals shall be released after the same be submitted to an engineer authorized by the city to review said plans if the city building official finds that such proposed building structure or improvement meets the required standards the building official shall issue a permit therefore 2 if the building official shall find any features of such proposed building structure addition alteration or relocation not clearly covered and defined by the ordinances of the city which in the building officials opinion may be dangerous or constitute a fire hazard the building official shall promptly report the case to the city manager and no permits shall be issued except upon order of the city manager such order shall be endorsed upon the face of the permit 3 if in the process of erecting any building structure addition alteration or relocation for which a building permit has been issued any feature is being incorporated in or upon the same which was not specified in the application for such permit or if such feature is not clearly covered or defined in any ordinance of the city or is in the building officials opinion dangerous or may constitute a fire hazard the building official shall order further work upon such objectionable feature stopped and report the same to the city manager work upon such objectionable feature may be continued only upon the approval and order of the city manager 4 if in the process of erecting any building structure addition alteration or relocation for which a building permit is required an excavation is to be made which in the opinion of the building official may be or may become dangerous there shall be imposed and enforced on the face of the building permit a condition that a fence sufficient in the opinion of the building official to protect the public from such danger shall be erected and maintained around the area to be excavated at all times while the excavation or any part thereof or any construction in the excavation remains open and in the opinion of the building official remains dangerous failure to comply with any such condition shall render the building permit void and the application for the building permit or the person who signs the building permit for and on behalf of the applicant may be punished for such failure to comply with the condition in the manner provided in this article each day that such condition is not complied with shall constitute a separate offense and may be punished separately 5 the building and codes department shall keep a record of all permits issued hereunder and shall file in the building department office this article the electrical inspector shall keep on file a list of inspected electrical appliances issued by underwriters laboratories inc which list shall be accessible for public reference during regular office hours    liabilities of inspectors where action is taken by the electrical inspector to enforce the provisions of this article such acts shall be done in the name of and on behalf of the city and the inspector in so acting for the city shall not render the inspector personally liable for any damage which may accrue to persons or property as a result of any act committed in good faith in the discharge of the inspectors duties and any suit brought against the inspector by reason thereof shall be defended by the city attorney until final termination of the proceedings contained therein    authority of electrical inspectors whenever in the opinion of an electrical inspector it shall be necessary to call upon the police department for aid and assistance the electrical inspector shall have the authority to do so and it shall be the duty of any member of the police department when called upon by the inspector to act immediately in giving the necessary and lawful assistance the electrical inspector shall have the right during reasonable hours to enter any building or premises in the discharge of official duty or for the purpose of making any inspection reinspection or test of the electrical equipment or installation contained therein when any electrical equipment is found by the inspector to be dangerous to persons or property because it is defective or improperly installed the person owning the electrical equipment shall be notified in writing and shall have any changes or repairs made as required by the electrical inspector which will place such equipment in safe condition if such work is not complete within the period specified by the inspector in the notice the inspector shall have the authority to disconnect or order the disconnection of electric service to the dangerous electrical equipment in cases of emergency when necessary for safety to persons or property or when electrical equipment may interfere with the work of the fire department the senior officer of the fire department at the site shall have the authority to immediately cause the disconnection of any electrical equipment    serving of notices a when any order or notice is issued pursuant to the provisions of this article to any person who cannot be found after a reasonable search then such order or notice may be served by posting it in a conspicuous place upon the premises occupied by that person or upon the premises where the defects are alleged to exist such posting of the notice shall be considered equivalent to personal service of the order or notice an order sent by mail in a sealed envelope with postage prepaid and directed to the address of the electrical contractor owner lessee or occupant of the premises shall be equivalent to personal service of the order b the electrical inspector is hereby empowered to attach to electrical cabinets and equipment any official notice or seal to prevent the use of electricity and it shall be unlawful for any other person to place or attach such seal or to break change destroy tear mutilate cover or otherwise deface or injure any official notice or seal posted by an electrical inspector    special ruling if a special ruling by the electrical inspector is necessary to govern electrical construction for some particular occupancy or building not covered by this in any building located outside the corporate limits of the city connected or to be connected to the public electric utilities of the city to report the same to the electrical inspector immediately upon completion of the wiring the electrical inspector shall within 24 hours thereafter make a careful inspection of the wiring so reported and if the same be approved the electrical inspector shall upon the payment of the fees provided in this article issue to the owner or agent of the building in which the wiring has been done a certificate to the effect that the wiring has been approved and shall authorize the delivery and maintenance of an electric current in the building b when any electric equipment is to be hidden from view by the permanent placement of parts of the building the person installing the equipment shall notify the electrical inspector and such equipment shall not be concealed until it has been inspected approved or authorized by the electrical inspector or until 24 hours exclusive of saturdays sundays and holidays shall have elapsed from the time of such notification on large installations where the concealment of equipment proceeds continuously the person installing the electrical equipment shall give the electrical inspector due notice and inspections shall be made periodically during the progress of the work c the electrical inspector shall have the authority to require building contractors to open such work which in any manner conceals electrical wiring that has been closed without the electrical inspectors knowledge or permission and in no case shall inspectors issue clearance until satisfied that the work is in accordance with the provisions of this article inspectors shall also have the right to refuse to issue a clearance on any wiring that is concealed in such manner that it cannot be fully determined that it has been done in accordance with this article    certificate of approval a when the electrical inspector finds the installation to be in conformity with the provisions of this article the electrical inspector shall issue to the person firm or corporation making the installation a certificate of approval with duplicate copy for delivery to the owner authorizing the use of the installation and connection to the supply of electricity and shall send written notice of such authorization to the city municipal utilities who will supply the electrical service b when a certificate of approval is issued authorizing the connection and use of a temporary installation the certificate shall expire at a time to be stated therein and shall be revocable for cause by the electrical inspector c permission may be given authorizing the connection and use of certain specified portions of an incompleted installation  the preliminary connection shall be revocable at the discretion of the electrical inspector d in no case shall certificates of approval be issued on installations or parts of installations where the work installed does not conform to the requirements of this article e if upon inspection the installation is not found to be fully in conformity with the provisions of this article the electrical inspector shall immediately notify the person firm or corporation making the installation of the existing defects f no certificate of approval shall be issued unless the electric conductor or equipment has been installed in strict conformity with the provisions of this article and unless the installation is made in compliance with nationally approved methods of construction for safety to life and property as herein set forth g the electrical inspector shall be deemed the judge of whether the installation of electric conductors and equipment has been made in accordance with the requirements of this article    connection to installations it shall be unlawful for any person firm or corporation to make connection to a supply of electricity to any electrical equipment for which a permit is required or which has been disconnected by the order of the electrical inspector until a certificate of approval has been issued by the electrical inspector authorizing the connection and use of such equipment  provided that the electrical inspector may authorize a temporary connection    reinspection the electrical inspector shall periodically reinspect existing installation of electrical conductors and equipment when the installation of any conductors or equipment is found to be in a dangerous or unsafe condition the person firm or corporation owning using or operating the installation shall be notified in writing and shall make the necessary repairs or changes required to place the conductors or equipment in safe condition and have the work completed within the period specified by the electrical inspector    condemnation a if in the judgment of the electrical inspector after inspection the electrical conductors appliances or equipment in any building are unsafe or dangerous to persons or property the inspector shall have the power to cause the wires or appliances to be disconnected from the source of electrical energy supplying these conductors or equipment and may at the electrical inspectors discretion seal the control switches for the same in an open or disconnected position where upon the electrical inspector shall give notice to the owner or the owners agent or by posting such notice at the site and shall also notify the city municipal utilities serving the premises thereafter it shall be unlawful for any person to cause or permit electric current to be supplied to the electrical conductors appliances or equipment so sealed until they shall have been made safe and the inspector shall have issued a certificate of approval to that effect b it shall be the duty of the electrical inspector to cause all dead wires unused poles or electric apparatus on the outside of the buildings or in streets or alleys to be removed at the expense of the owners thereof by giving the owners written notice c when the electrical inspector condemns all or part of any electrical installation the owner may within five days after receiving written notice thereof file a petition in writing for review of the action of the electrical inspector by the governing body of the city upon the receipt of which the governing body shall at once proceed to determine the facts and within five days make a decision in accordance with their findings    changes  alterations it shall be unlawful for any unauthorized person to in any manner change or alter electrical conductors or equipment in or on any building if in the course of the erection of a building or structure electrical conductors or equipment are in such position as to interfere with the erection or completion of the structure notice shall be immediately given the authorized person installing the electrical conductors or equipment and the needed change shall be made by such authorized person    standards for electric installations the national electrical by section 8215 shall constitute the minimum standards for provisions of this article except for special requirements set forth in sections 8261      wiring methods the following rules and regulations shall be observed for wiring 1 fire limits a all electric wiring for light heat or power shall be wired in approved rigid conduit electrical metallic tubing metalclad mc cable metal raceway or underwriters laboratories tested and approved flexible electrical nonmetallic conduit may be used in nonexposed areas one and twofamily dwellings which shall be wired according to the national electrical disconnect shall be placed on the outside of the building nearest the point of entry or on the city utility pole after first obtaining permission from the city electric distribution department b all buildings hereafter constructed or additions to existing buildings or for extensions or for additional wiring in such buildings flexible metallic conduit may be used for fishing in concealed wall or ceiling spaces of existing buildings or for short flexible connections not in excess of three feet for equipment requiring some flexibility flexible nonmetallic conduit may also be used for this purpose where the requirements of the section would in any way weaken the structure andor be detrimental to the structure the electrical inspector may grant permission in writing to use some other approved type wiring method in construction c all service entrance conductors to buildings used for business purposes in the fire limits shall be provided with a main disconnection switch or breaker of the safety enclosed type and operated from outside of the enclosure and so marked as to indicate whether the switch is on or off and shall be located at a readily accessible point nearest to the entrance of the conductors on the outside of the building or structure or must have written approval of the city electrical inspector the disconnecting switch shall control all circuits and devices d existing residential houses converted to business uses shall be allowed to continue their use of wiring methods of nm cable romex or knob and tube wiring when provided with a written statement from a properly licensed electrical contractor stating that existing wiring has been inspected and found to be in a safe condition and that the service is adequate for the new loads provided the house has not been renovated to a point where it is feasible to wire in an approved raceway all extensions and additions to existing wiring shall be in an approved raceway and future structure additions or alterations shall include rewiring the entire building to comply with the wiring method in approved conduit this section shall apply only to buildings with an occupant load of less than 50 persons 2 outside fire limits a all electrical wiring for lights heat or power in all buildings constructed to be used for business purposes churches public buildings manufacturing establishments institutional buildings and other places of assembly located outside the fire limits except existing frame apartments and motel buildings new or existing that do not exceed three floors above grade the first floor of such building being that floor which is designed for human habitation and which has 50 percent or more of its perimeter level with or above the finished grade of the exterior wall line shall be wired in approved rigid conduit electrical metallic tubing metal raceway metal clad mc cable or ul tested and approved flexible electrical nonmetallic conduit except flexible metallic conduit may be used for fishing in concealed ceiling or wall spaces of existing buildings and for short flexible connections not in excess of three feet where the equipment requires some flexibility flexible nonmetallic conduit may also be used for this purpose b all raceways installed in poured concrete floors ceilings or outside poured walls shall be rigid conduit or cellular duct or flexible nonmetallic conduit when approved by the city electrical inspector for that purpose where the requirements of this section in any way would weaken the structure or be detrimental to the structure the electrical inspector may grant permission in writing to use some other type of approved wiring method in the construction all feeders 100 ampere or larger shall be in approved raceway c each set of conductors to buildings outside the fire limits hereafter constructed or additions to existing of the international plumbing or hereafter incorporated by the governing body the following terms shall be defined as follows 1 employing plumber is any person who maintains a regularly established plumbing shop who does not personally engage in work as a plumber but employs master plumbers to do or supervise the plumbing work for the shop 2 master plumber is hereby defined as any person who has served at least three years as a journeyman plumber and who has passed the examination of the board of examiners hereinafter provided for 3 journeyman plumber is any person who has served at least two years as an apprentice plumber and who has been examined and found by the board of examiners to be qualified to be licensed as a plumber but does not possess the qualifications of a master plumber 4 apprentice plumber is any person who is actually working at plumbing under the direct supervision of a master plumber with the intention of qualifying to become a journeyman plumber 5 appliance a device which utilizes gas fuel to produce light heat refrigeration or power 6 branch lines or branches those pipes which convey gas from a supply line to appliances 7 concealed gas piping piping which when in place in a finished building will be hidden from view by the structure 8 gas fitter journeyman a person who has been approved by the plumbers examining board of the city showing such person to be qualified to do gas piping install appliances make repairs to gas piping systems and appliance or in any way work at the trade of gas piping for a qualified master gas fitter or master plumber a gas fitter shall have a current certificate issued by the abovementioned board showing him or her to be so qualified 9 gas fitter master a person who has been approved by the plumbers examining board of the city showing him to be qualified to engage in the business of gas piping installation of gas appliances the making of repairs to gas piping systems and appliances and who has a license and bond as required by this a current certificate issued by the abovementioned board showing him or her to be so qualified 10 house piping the system of piping within a building either exposed or concealed which conveys gas from the outlet of the service meter to appliances at various places throughout the building any piping underground which contains measured gas 11 outlet the end of a branch line to which a gas burning appliance is or may be attached 12 portable appliance a gas burning unit which by use demands that the same be moved from place to place such as gas pressing iron bunsen burner or similar device  2 3152011 plumbers certificate required any person now or hereafter engaging or working at the business of plumbing in the city either as a master plumber employing plumber  or as a be used when rough work or drainage and ventilation in any building shall have been constructed and before same is covered from view the plumber doing such work shall notify the plumbing inspector in writing or otherwise that the work is ready for inspection no inspection shall be called for until the job is ready the inspector shall make the inspection within 24 hours after inspection has been called for if the work shall be found by the inspector to comply with the ordinances of the city and shall stand the required tests as provided in the plumbing the city then the inspector shall approve the work and the work may then be covered in case the work shall not comply with the ordinances and the plumber shall make such changes as are necessary to be made to cause the work to comply with the same as directed by the plumbing inspector if the plumber fails to make the necessary changes within 48 hours the plumber shall forfeit the right to obtain permits until the changes are made rules and regulations governing gas service shall be as follows 1 the size of the service pipe shall be in accordance with the american gas association standards service pipe shall be laid at a depth of not less than 12 inches and shall be laid in a ditch separated from the ditches of water sewer or other underground pipes or conduits by no less than 18 inches of solid undisturbed earth gas service line laid parallel to a foundation wall shall be laid on a line not less than two feet from such foundation wall and on solid undisturbed earth in no case shall a service line be laid parallel to the building in the backfill along the foundation wall where a service or supply line passes foundation wall except where such wall is on a property line the same shall enter the building above grade a swing joint shall be construed at the meter loop and also where the service line comes up to enter the building 2 a standard brass or iron body brass core stopcock or shutoff valve shall be placed in the service line in an accessible position immediately ahead of the meter  2 3152011 gas meters rules and regulations governing gas meters shall be as follows 1 gas shall not be turned on by gas company except as provided in this article unless the gas company serving the premises tests the piping by observing the meter dial and finds it to be gastight 2 gas meters shall be located a safe distance from equipment where there is an unguarded flame or the possibility of electric sparks there shall be at least eight feet between a meter and a coal wood oil or gas fired furnace 3 when meter locations are inside a building such locations shall be as close as possible to the point of entry of the service line in no case exceeding 20 feet gas piping at the meter locations shall be rigid and capable of supporting the meter without undue strain of vibration piping from point of entry to meter shall be exposed meters shall not be placed in driveways public passages halls coal bins or other places where they are subject to damage or in places where they will be subjected to excessive corrosion meters shall be placed in outside locations accessible for inspection installation and removal meters shall not be placed under steps under unventilated bulkheads or show windows or in bedroom bathroom or small confined places such as closets and lavatories not under a sink over an electric or gas fixture or within three feet of an electric meter or switch box when located inside of a building 4 no person other than an employee of the gas company serving the premises shall disconnect remove connect or change the location of a meter or service regulator without a permit from the gas company serving the premises the moving of a meter or the construction of an additional meter loop requires a permit and inspection by the plumbing inspector unmetered gas shall not be piped under a building to a meter location outside the building  2 3152011 secs 83208324  reserved truth in advertising official the building official shall give notice in writing to the person to whom the license was issued that the license has been revoked upon receipt of the notice of revocation such person shall cease operation of such mobile home park     i 352019 license  denied or revoked any person whose application for a license has been denied or any person whose license has been revoked may request and shall be granted a hearing of the matter before the governing body upon filing an application for hearing before such body within three days following the day on which such notice was received or license denied and the governing body shall hold such hearing within 21 days after the filing of such application the filing of such application shall not suspend any order of the building official in denying application for license until the matter has been determined by the governing body     i 352019 duty to maintain park it shall be the duty of the mobile home park owner or licensee to enforce all provisions of this article and to see that such licensed park is kept neat clean and orderly at all times a copy of this article and a copy of each license shall be posted in a conspicuous place in the licensed park    duty to keep records it shall be the duty of the licensee to keep an accurate record of all mobile home owners and occupants using the mobile home park the register shall contain the following information 1 name and address of each occupant 2 make model and year of all automobiles and mobile homes 3 license number and owner of each trailer and automobile by which it is towed and the state of its issuance 4 dates of arrival and departure of each mobile home register must be made available to all law enforcement officers at all times and such register shall not be xiv  building contractors footnotes  6  state law reference general building and residential contractors ksa 121556 et seq definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning contractor means any person who contracts to perform work or service at a certain price or rate the work of a contractor consists of but is not limited to building construction repairs alterations additions remodeling or wrecking of any building or structure or any portion thereof concrete work roofing siding erection or construction of pools and fences within the city or which a permit is required the definition pertains only to those persons which are in the business of construction and does not refer to individuals working under the supervision of the property owner license types  there is hereby created the following categories of licenses required by the city class a general contractor license shall entitle the holder thereof to contract for and to perform any act as a contractor as defined in this section for building remodeling or repairing of any structure or addition thereto that is permitted by this title with an unlimited valuation a contractor of this classification must have a minimum of five years of construction related experience in commercial industrial and residential construction in addition a contractor of this classification must successfully pass an examination from a nationally recognized third party testing agency with a minimum score of 75 percent class b building contractor license shall entitle the holder thereof to contract for and to perform any act as a contractor as defined in this section limited to the erection addition to remodeling and wrecking of commercial buildings and single and multiple dwelling residential buildings not exceeding three stories in height and nonstructural remodels to commercial buildings exceeding three stories in height a contractor of this classification must have a minimum of four years of construction related experience in commercial and residential construction in addition a contractor of this classification must successfully pass an examination from a nationally recognized third party testing agency with a minimum score of 75 percent class c residential contractor license shall entitle the holder thereof to contract for and to perform any act as a contractor as defined in this section limited to construction remodeling repair or wrecking of one and twofamily residences and building accessory thereto a contractor of this classification must have a minimum of three years of construction related experience in residential construction in addition a contractor of this classification must successfully pass an examination from a nationally recognized third party testing agency with a minimum score of 75 percent class d specialty building contractor shall entitle the holder thereof to contract for and to perform any act as a contractor as defined in this section limited to the remodel repair and maintenance of dwelling units as defined by each category a contractor of this classification must have a minimum of two years of construction related experience in residential construction in addition a contractor of this classification must successfully pass an examination from a nationally recognized third party testing agency with a minimum score of 75 percent  3 2212012  i 352019 state law reference general building and period stated unless such license is revoked    license book the city clerk shall keep a book in which shall be entered the name of each and every person licensed the licensees address the date of the license the purpose for which it is granted the amount paid therefor and the time when the same shall expire    licenses not transferable  no refunds no license issued under the provisions of this article shall be transferable or assignable there shall be no refunds    licenses to be carried and presented for inspection all persons doing business in a permanent location are hereby required to have their license conspicuously displayed in their place of business and all persons to whom licenses are issued not having a permanent place of business are hereby required to carry their licenses with them and any licensee shall present the license for inspection when required to do so by any citizen or officer of the city    penalty any person who shall conduct or pursue in the city limits any trade occupation or business for which a license is required by this article after a license should have been obtained to conduct or pursue such trade occupation or business without having obtained the same shall be deemed to do so unlawfully any person violating any of the provisions of this article shall upon conviction thereof be punished by a fine of not less than $500 nor more than $10000 each day that any business trade occupation or profession is conducted without the license fee having been paid shall constitute a separate offense    secs 10341054  reserved article iii  peddlers solicitors transient merchants definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning canvasser or solicitor means any individual whether resident of the city or not traveling either by foot automobile motor truck or any other type of conveyance from place to place from house to house or from street to street taking or attempting to take orders for sale of goods wares and merchandise personal property of any nature whatsoever for future delivery or for services to be furnished or performed in the future whether or not such individual has carries or exposes for sale a sample of the subject of such sale or whether such individual is collecting advance payments on such sales or not such definition includes any person who for such person or for another person hires leases uses or occupies any building structure tent railroad boxcar boat hotel room lodginghouse apartment shop or any other place within the city for the sole purpose of exhibiting samples and taking orders for future delivery peddler means any individual whether a resident of the city or not traveling by foot wagon automotive vehicle or any other type of conveyance from place to place from house to house or from street to street carrying conveying or transporting goods wares merchandise ice cream milk products meats fish vegetables fruits garden truck farm products or provisions offering and exposing the same for sale or making sales and delivering articles to purchasers or who without traveling from place to place shall sell or offer the same for sale from automotive vehicle railroad boxcar or other vehicle or conveyance and further provided that one who solicits orders and as a separate transaction makes deliveries to purchasers as a part of a scheme or design to evade the provisions of this article shall be deemed a peddler residence means and includes every separate living unit occupied for residential purposes by one or more persons contained within any type of building or structure soliciting means and includes any one or more of the following activities 1 seeking to obtain orders for the purchase of goods wares merchandise foodstuffs services of any kind character or description whatever for any kind of consideration whatever  2 seeking to obtain prospective customers for application or purchase of insurance of any type kind or character  or 3 seeking to obtain subscriptions to books magazines periodicals newspapers and every other type or kind of publication street salesperson means any person engaged in any manner in selling merchandise of any kind from a wagon or stand temporarily located on the public streets or sidewalks of the city transient merchant itinerant merchant or itinerant vendor means any individual whether as owner agent consignee or employee whether a resident of the city or not who engages in a temporary business of selling and delivering goods wares and merchandise within such city and who in furtherance of such purpose hires leases uses or occupies any building structure motor vehicle tent railroad boxcar or boat public room in hotels lodginghouses apartments shops or any street alley or other place within the city for the exhibition and sale of such goods wares and merchandise either privately or at public auction such definition shall not be construed to include any person who while occupying such temporary location does not sell from stock but exhibits samples only for the purpose of securing orders for future delivery only the person so engaged shall not be relieved from complying with the provisions of this article merely by reason of associating temporarily with any local dealer trader merchant or auctioneer or by conducting such transient business in connection with as a part of or in the name of any local dealer trader merchant or auctioneer    license required no individual shall engage in the activities as defined in section 1055 within the corporate limits of the city without first obtaining a license any applicant for a license under this article shall file with the city clerk a sworn application on a form furnished by the city clerk which shall give the following information or require the submittal of the following documents 1 name and date of birth of applicant 2 state sales tax number 3 credentials from the person whom the applicant is employed by or represents 4 current photographic government identification of the applicant 5 period of time for which the certificate and license is applied 6 address of the applicants present place of residence 7 a brief description of the nature of the business and the goods to be sold 8 location and zoning of any temporary facility structure building or vehicle 9 whether or not the applicant has ever been convicted of a crime involving moral turpitude or any felony conviction    issuance of license upon receipt of an application for a license the city clerk shall issue a license such license shall contain the signature and seal of the issuing officer and shall show the name and address of the licensee the date of issuance and length of time the license shall be operative and the nature of the business involved the city clerk shall keep a permanent record of all such licenses issued and submit a copy of such license to the chief of police the solicitor shall carry the license with the solicitor at all times    license fee  exemptions a the fee for the license required pursuant to section 1056 shall be on file in the city clerks office b no license fee shall be required of businesses located with the city limits that have maintained a physical address for public access for at least three consecutive years  producers and growers or their agents or employees engaged in the sale of farm or garden products or fruits grown within this state  any businesses trades or occupations which are part of fairs or celebrations sponsored by the city or any other governmental subdivision or the state or when part of all the expenses of said fairs or celebrations are paid for by the city any other governmental subdivision or the state      7202004 state law reference exemption from fee for any producer grower or agent or employee for agricultural or aquacultural products grown in the state ksa 121617 revocation of license a the chief of police may revoke any license issued under this article for any of the following causes 1 fraud misrepresentation or false statement contained in the application for license 2 fraud misrepresentation or false statement made in the course of carrying on the business 3 any violation of this article 4 conducting the businesses in an unlawful manner or in such a manner as to constitute a breach of the peace or to constitute a menace to the health safety or general welfare of the city notice of the revocation of a license shall be in writing to the applicant and the city clerk and set forth the grounds of revocation b any person aggrieved by the action of the chief of police or city clerk in the denial of an application or revocation of a license as provided in this article shall have the right of appeal to the governing body such appeal shall be taken by filing with the city clerk within 14 days after notice of revocation or denial of the license has been mailed to such applicants last known address setting forth the grounds for appeal the governing body shall set a time and place for a hearing on such appeal and notice of such hearing shall be given to the applicant in the same manner as provided herein for notice of hearing on revocation the decision and order of the governing body on such appeal shall be final and conclusive    use of street no peddler shall have any exclusive right to any location in the public streets nor shall a peddler be permitted a stationary location nor shall a peddler be permitted to operate in any congested area where the peddlers operations might impede or inconvenience the public for the purpose of this article the judgment of a police officer exercised in good faith shall be deemed conclusive as to whether the area is congested or the public impeded or inconvenienced    enforcement of this article it shall be the duty of any police officer to require any person engaged in the activities as defined in this article who is not known by such officer to be duly licensed to produce such persons license and to enforce the provisions of this article against any person found to be violating the same    secs 10621080  reserved article iv  drilling of oil or gas wells permit no person shall commence the drilling of a well for oil or gas within the city limits without first having procured from the city a permit therefor to be issued by authority of the governing body in accordance with the terms and conditions of this article    file application  city clerk before any permit shall be granted for the commencement of a well for the production of oil or gas an application therefor shall be filed with the city clerk such application shall show 1 that the applicant has good and valid oil and gas leases from property owners covering at least a tenacre tract 2 evidence of agreement in writing between the lessee and the lessors if more than one providing for a pooling of all royalties arising from production on the tract to be distributed to the property owners in accordance with the number of acres of each owner in the tract 3 the application shall be accompanied by a plat or map of such tract showing the proposed location of the well which location shall in no instance be closer than 300 feet of any boundary line of the tract unless by the unanimous vote of the governing body but not upon any street or alley  such map shall show the location of each residence upon the tract and all improvements 4 a drilling agreement providing adequate protection to the parties in interest by enclosing the drilling rig on all sides equipping same with adequate fire extinguishers which are to be kept in good order including a reasonable and adequate plan for the handling of the slush basis sediment and salt water that may be produced in the drilling of the well  and facilities for handling production to the end that it may not be necessary to store oil on said area in excess of 500 barrels per well  such agreement shall make further provision that in the event the well is a dry hole or nonproductive of either oil or gas all materials equipment tools and machinery of every kind and character shall be removed therefrom within 60 days and the premises fully restored to their original condition as nearly as practicable    applicant bonded a good and sufficient surety bond signed by the applicant and by a corporate surety authorized to do business in the state or a cash deposit in such amount as deemed sufficient by the governing body but in no event less than $250000 shall be tendered to the governing body and approved by the city clerk prior to the issuance of a permit pursuant to the terms of this article conditioned upon faithful compliance with the terms and conditions hereof and any amendments hereto and further conditioned upon saving and holding the city free and harmless from any damage resulting to the city as a result of drilling pumping repair or other operations by the permittee the laying of pipelines the setting of tanks or as a result of the moving of machinery and equipment over any street of the city the permittee or the permittees assignee shall pay the annual premium due upon said surety bond before the annual maturity thereof and shall file a receipt therefor in the office of the city clerk the permittee shall carry and maintain public liability insurance on each well or group of wells and upon the vehicular equipment used in connection therewith indemnifying payment of not less than $2500000 for injury or death of any one person and not less than $5000000 aggregate for any one accident and not less than $2500000 property damage for any one accident and file good and sufficient proof thereof and proof of the payment of the renewal of premiums thereon with the city clerk default by permittee in complying with any provision of this article  or any amendments hereto that the governing body may revoke any such permit after five days notice to permittee by registered mail and thereupon permittee shall cease and desist from all operations under and pursuant to any such permit    application fee the application as provided in this article shall be filed with the city clerk and a fee therefor on file in the city clerks office shall be required upon the filing of the application the same shall be considered by the governing body and if the governing body shall deem such application adequate and the drilling of the well not injurious to public or private property the same shall be granted if a permit is denied the filing fee shall be refunded to the applicant    refusal of application the governing body shall have the power and reserves the authority to refuse any application for a permit whereby reason of the proposed application for the proposed well and character and value of the permanent improvements already erected on the tract applied for or adjacent thereto and the uses to which the land and surroundings are adopted for civic purposes or for sanitary reason the drilling of a gas or oil well will be a serious disadvantage to the city and its inhabitants as a whole when a permit shall be refused for any of these reasons but not otherwise the deposit or cash paid with the application shall be returned to the applicant except as provided in this article if an application be found by the governing body to comply in all respects with this article the city clerk shall be authorized to issue a permit for the drilling of the well provided for and the permit shall specify the particular location of the well to be drilled and it shall be unlawful for the permittee to drill elsewhere in the tract    requirements of operation in operating under any permit issued under this article or any amendment thereto all oil gas and water produced or arising from the operations shall be piped or otherwise conveyed or removed from the limits of the city except the ordinary use of a slush pond and the temporary storage of not to exceed 500 barrels of oil for each well  and all excavations and slush ponds shall be completely enclosed with six feet woven wire fence that the laying of any pipe lines by any permittee shall be done under the supervision of the city engineer    premises to be restored it shall be the duty of every person to whom a permit may be issued as provided in this article after the well has been drilled in the event the same is a dry hole or abandoned to remove the derrick drilling tools equipment and machinery from the location of the well and to restore the premises to their original condition as nearly as it is practical so to do and to see that the well is properly plugged in the event oil or gas is produced from such well then it shall be the duty of the holder of the permit upon the completion of the drilling of the well to remove all machinery equipment and material not necessary to be retained for use in the production of the oil or gas from such well and insofar as can be done consistent with the production from such well to restore the premises to their original condition as nearly as practical all of which either in the event of a dry hole or a producing well shall be done within 60 days after the completion of the drilling of the well    permission to drill no permit shall be granted or issued for the drilling of a well except upon ground held by the applicant under oil and gas mining lease grant or drilling contract from the owner giving the owners permission to drill the well  and when a permit shall have been issued the same shall terminate and become inoperative without any action on the part of the governing body unless within 60 days from the date of issue of such permit actual drilling of the well shall have been commenced and after the drilling of a well shall have commenced the cessation for a like period of the drilling operations shall cancel the permit and the well shall be considered as abandoned for all purposes of this article and it shall be unlawful thereafter to continue drilling of such well without the issuance of another permit neither this article nor any permit issued hereunder shall be interpreted to grant any right or license to permittee to enter upon or occupy in any respect in the drilling or production operations any land except by the written consent of the owner  nor shall it limit or prevent the free right of any landowner to contract for the amount of royalty to be paid with respect to the landowners own land    duration of permit no permit which shall be issued under this article or under any amendment hereto or any rights privileges or franchise granted hereby or hereunder shall exist longer than for a period of ten years from the date of the issuance of the permit or as long thereafter as oil andor gas is produced from the tract    penalty any violation of any of the terms of this article whether herein denominated as unlawful or not shall be deemed a misdemeanor and any person convicted of any such violation shall be fined in a sum not exceeding $50000 and any person so convicted shall be committed to jail until such fine and costs are paid each day of the continuance of any such violation shall be considered a separate offense and any person agent or employee engaged in any such violation shall on conviction be so punished therefor    secs 109110108  reserved article v  taxicabs license required it shall be unlawful for any person to operate on any of the streets avenues alleys or public places in the city any automobile or other vehicle used for the transportation of persons for hire without first obtaining a license for each automobile or other vehicle in the manner and form herein prescribed and complying with all of the provisions of this article and other laws of the city relating to the operation of such vehicles for hire for the transportation of persons this article shall not apply to motor carriers duly licensed by the state corporation commission or other authorized regulatory body of the state which motor carriers are required by the state to carry insurance    application for license  contents any person desiring to secure such license from the city for the carrying of passengers for hire within the city shall file an application in writing with the city clerk for such license which application shall be made by the person owning the automobile or other vehicle and the application shall contain the following information 1 full name and address of owner of the vehicle to be licensed  2 engine number and license tag number of the state and a complete description of the motor vehicle  3 principal place of business and address from which the motor vehicle is proposed to be operated  4 the name and address of the chauffeurs or person who shall actually operate or drive the vehicle and such person shall not be less than 21 years of age two or more persons may be named as the operators of the vehicle the city manager or the city managers designee must be satisfied that the persons named as operators of the motor vehicles are careful and competent operators or drivers  5 such other information as may be required by the governing body    public convenience and necessity  heariessity  hearing of application upon the receipt of the application the governing body shall hold a hearing thereon and if the governing body finds that public convenience and necessity requires the licensing and operation of the taxicab in addition to such other taxicabs as may at the time be operating under licenses issued by the city and if it deems the applicant therefor to be of good moral character and financially able to provide the service the public requires and that the applicant or any person employed by the applicant will operate the taxicab for which a license is desired properly and for the best interest and convenience of the public and that the applicant will conform to and obey the laws of the city relative to the operation of taxicabs and all other laws of the city and all laws of the state the governing body shall by resolution approve such application the governing body shall not approve or have in effect at any one time licenses for taxicabs in a number in excess of the number which the governing body may reasonably deem necessary for the best interests and convenience of the inhabitants of the city or the general public or in such number that the owners and operators of the licensed taxicabs and the employees of such owners or operators might in the opinion of the governing body be apt to engage in practices which would be detrimental to the best interests of the city and the citys inhabitants and the general public the governing body shall reject and deny any application in the event it considers the granting of the license would increase the number of taxicabs licensed to operate in the city beyond the number reasonably necessary for the best interest and convenience of the inhabitants of the city and the general public andor for any other reason the governing body deems that the granting of such license would be detrimental to the public interest and welfare    insurance before any license for a taxicab or vehicle carrying passengers for hire within the corporate limits of the city shall be issued under the provisions of this article the owner or operator thereof shall file with the city clerk an insurance policy approved by the city attorney providing insurance coverage for each and every taxicab or vehicle carrying passengers for hire owned operated or leased by such person with a liability coverage of not less than $5000000 for injury or death to any one person and $10000000 for the injury or death of any number of persons in any one accident and with coverage of at least $2000000 for property damage in any one accident and such insurance coverage shall be effective whether the taxicab or vehicle is at the time of any accident being driven by the owner the owners agent lessee or licensee  such insurance policy shall contain all the conditions required by the laws of the state and by the insurance commissioner of the state and shall carry a uniform endorsement for actual notice to the city of any changes thereon  the policy and endorsement thereon shall be in a form approved by the city attorney and the insurance policy shall further provide that it cannot be canceled until ten days written notice shall have been filed with the city clerk in the event the insurance policy shall be canceled or for any reason become ineffective the governing body shall cancel the license or in the event the licensee or any of the licensees agents or employees operating the motor vehicle may be convicted of a crime or a misdemeanor under the laws of the state or the laws of the city the governing body of the city may cancel the license      license to be issued upon the adoption of a resolution by the governing body approving the application as provided in section 10111 and the filing of the insurance policy as herein provided and paying the license fee on file in the city clerks office for each vehicle or taxicab to be used by the applicant the city clerk shall issue a license to the applicant for a term of one year commencing on january 1 and terminating on december 31 of each year and such license may be transferred from one vehicle to another owned by the same person the number of taxicabs or vehicles owned or operated by the same person at any one time shall not exceed the number of licenses applied and paid for upon the substitution or change of motor vehicles by the licensee the insurance policy shall be endorsed so as to cover the operation of the substituted vehicle    license may be revoked any owner or operator of any taxicab or vehicle operated for hire over the streets alleys and public places of the city shall keep and maintain each and all motor vehicles in safe and suitable mechanical condition for taxicab service and upon failure to do so the governing body may revoke the license as to any unsafe or unsuitable vehicle    penalty any person convicted of violating any provision of this article shall be punished by a fine which shall be on file in the city clerks office the conviction of any such person of violating any of the provisions of this article shall work an immediate revocation of such persons license    secs 1011610142  reserved article vi  garage sales definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning garage sale means any sale operated out of a singlefamily dwelling or a twofamily dwelling or a multiplefamily dwelling being of two hours or more duration goods includes any goods wares merchandise or any other property capable of being the object of a sale regulated hereunder person means any person firm partnership association corporation company or organization of any kind    penalty any person violating any of the provisions of this article shall be deemed guilty of a public offense and upon conviction thereof shall be fined in a sum not exceeding $10000 or sentenced to 30 days in jail or both    frequency of sales it shall be unlawful for any person to hold more than two garage sales at the same location within a calendar year    length of sales it shall be unlawful for any person to conduct a garage sale lasting longer than three consecutive days    advertising signs no signs advertising the sale or giving directions to its location shall be used erected or allowed except one sign shall be allowed in the front yard of the sale location during the time of the sale    secs 1014810179  reserved article vii  tree trimming within the city from performing the foregoing activities on premises so owned or occupied    application a written application for a license shall contain the following information 1 the name business $2500    issuance upon the approval of the application and the filing by the applicant of sufficient proof of insurance coverage as required in this article together with a surety bond meeting the set forth in the license the performance by the licensee of work not specified in the license shall be a violation of this article for which the license may be revoked andor other penalties provided in this article imposed    bond and insurance before any license is issued or renewed under the provision of this article there shall be filed in the office of the city 1 a certificate of insurance in thirty days shall elapse between the last publication and the date set for the hearing a copy of the resolution shall be mailed by restricted mail within three days after the first publication to each such owner agent lienholder of record and occupant at the last known address  hearing at the time and place fixed for the hearing or any adjournment thereof the governing body shall hear all evidence submitted by the code official the owner agent lienholder and occupants if the governing body determines the structures or equipment to be unsafe resolution fixing a reasonable time within which repair or removal shall be commenced and the premises made safe shall be passed if repair alteration or improvement of a structure or equipment cannot be made at a cost of 50 percent or less than its value the structure or equipment shall be demolished or removed such resolution shall be published in the official city newspaper once and an official copy of the resolution shall be mailed by editors note  adopted  repealed  2080 which pertained to amendments to international fire derived from ii adopted aug 3 2004 accumulation of rubbish and trash it shall be unlawful for any person to allow to accumulate or to keep in any part of any building or outside of and adjacent to any building or in any alley sidewalk street or premises within 30 feet of any building any rubbish trash waste paper excelsior empty boxes barrels or other combustibles which shall constitute a fire hazard  stacking of hay or straw it shall be unlawful for any person to deposit stack or store any hay or straw within 500 feet of any building located inside the fire limits of the city  keeping of packing materials it shall be unlawful to keep excelsior or other packing material in any other than metal or wood metal line boxes or bins having selfclosing or automatic covers all refuse and trash from rooms where packing or unpacking is done shall be removed daily  storage of ashes it shall be unlawful to store ashes inside of any nonfireproof building unless they are stored in a noncombustible container or receptacle and a clearance of at least five feet shall be maintained between such container or receptacle and any combustible materials not placed therein ashes shall not be stored outside of any building in wooden plastic or paper product receptacles or dumped in contact with or in close proximity to any combustible materials  filling gasoline tanks of motor vehicles the engines of motor vehicles shall be stopped when the gasoline tanks of such vehicles are being filled with gasoline at service stations or other places where gasoline is supplied to motor vehicles the driver or person in control of such vehicle when the gasoline tank of same is being filled who refuses neglects or fails to stop the engine of such vehicle shall likewise be guilty of a violation of this  fire hazards generally it is unlawful for any person to cause or create anywhere within the city or to permit on any premises under such persons control any situation or condition that is conducive to or likely to cause or permit the outbreak of fire or the spreading of fire any situation or condition conducive to the outbreak of or spreading of fire is declared to be a fire hazard the violation of or failure to comply with any law pertaining to the storage handling or use of flammable oils explosives liquefied petroleum gases or fertilizers and all wires and other conductors charged with electricity is declared to be a fire hazard the placing of stools chairs or any other obstruction in the aisles hallways doorway or exit of any theater public hall auditorium church or other place of indoor public assemblage or the failure to provide any such place of public assemblage with sufficient accessible and unobstructed fire exits and escapes is also declared to be a fire hazard the obstruction of any street avenue alley fire hydrant or any other condition that might delay the fireems department in fighting fire is declared to be unlawful  inspections to discover fire hazards it shall be the duty of the fire chief to inspect or cause to be inspected by fireems department officers or members as often as may be necessary all buildings particularly all mercantile buildings manufacturing plants warehouses garages hotels boardinghouses roominghouses theaters auditoriums and all places of public assemblage for the purpose of discovering the violation of any fire preventive law or any fire hazard and ascertaining and causing to be corrected any conditions liable to cause fires and to see that all places of public assemblage hotels and roominghouses have sufficient and unobstructed facilities for escape therefrom in case of fire  abatement of fire hazards  issuing order whenever any officer or member of the fireems department shall find or discover any fire hazard or shall find in any building or upon any premises combustible or explosive material or dangerous accumulation of rubbish or unnecessary accumulation of paper boxes shavings or any other flammable material so situated as to endanger property by the probability of fire or shall find or discover any violation of this chapter or any other law hazardous to public safety from fires the fire chief shall order the fire hazard or danger from the fire forthwith abated and remedied and such order shall be complied with immediately by the owner or occupant of such buildings or premises if the hazard or condition ordered abated and remedied is a violation of or a failure to comply with any making such determination the proclamation shall be posted on the front door of the city administration center at 317 south washington avenue in the city at such other locations throughout the city as
