   law enforcement article i  in general secs 2412418  reserved article ii  police department footnotes  1  state law reference law enforcement officers ksa 124111 appointments the city manager shall appoint a chief of police and such number of regular and special police officers as the governing body may deem necessary for the best interest welfare and protection of the city    duties of city chief of police and assistants it shall be the duty of the chief of police and the assistant chief of police and other police officers to see that the laws of the state and all ordinances of the city and all resolutions of the governing body are properly enforced and obeyed within the police jurisdiction of the city whenever arrest is made they shall attend all trials in municipal court unless excused by the municipal judge    police chief powers  duties the chief of the police department shall under the direction of the city manager have complete control of the police department and shall be responsible for the proper organization training discipline and functioning of the police department and for the proper care use and safety of all property used in connection with such department    arrests by law enforcement personnel the law enforcement personnel shall have power to arrest all offenders against the laws of the state or of the city by day or night and house them in a suitable facility to prevent their escape until an appearance before the proper authority having jurisdiction    rules of conduct a all members of the police department including the chief of police shall be subject to the following rules of conduct 1 no proposed action or the contents of any order of the police department or case pending before the municipal court shall be made known to any person except those directly concerned with its execution and all police department business shall be treated as confidential 2 no public criticism or ridicule of any official action of this department or of the municipal court shall be made 3 members shall at all times be polite and considerate when dealing with the public and shall maintain proper decorum command of temper patience and discretion this subsection shall not however prevent the use of reasonable force to effect necessary action in enforcing the law 4 no member shall accept any bribes or use such members office to obtain money misuse police department property allow another person to use such members badge or identification drink intoxicating liquor while on duty or become drunk or conspicuously disorderly in any public place at any time 5 no member shall engage in political activity of any nature while on duty nor shall any member accept pay for any service performed during the members hours of duty 6 under no circumstances conduct official city business b conduct shall also be as defined by department policy    reward moneys  disposition all money due to or received by the chief of police or any law enforcement personnel on account of any reward accruing to the chief of police or any law enforcement personnel in consequence of any action in the line of duty shall be turned over to the credit of a fund for aid of law enforcement personnel of the city in payment of benefits for sickness and injury and allied uses if no such fund has been established by the police department the moneys shall be deposited with the city treasurer and shall become general funds of the city    reserve police force a a reserve police force is hereby established for the city for better and more efficient police protection of the city b the members of the reserve police force shall be appointed by the chief of police with the approval of the city manager and shall hold their office for a term of one year or until their successors are appointed and qualified c the reserve police force shall be under the general supervision of the chief of police and shall not draw any compensation for their services d the city shall endeavor to secure insurance coverage for members of the reserve police force comparable to that applicable to members of the police department in the absence of such insurance coverage the city shall not be liable for any injuries occurring to members of the reserve police force whether the injuries occur while the members are acting as reserve police officers or otherwise e the members of the reserve police force shall not have police powers except when actually called on active duty by the chief of police f no reserve police force member shall carry any firearm while on duty except on the expressed order of the chief of police g the chief of police shall formulate all necessary rules of the reserve police force relating to training conduct and duties to be performed by the reserve police force h the chief of police upon approval by the city manager may at any time without cause suspend or remove any member of the reserve police force in accordance with the provisions of the  disturbing the peace a statement of purpose it is the purpose of this section to protect individuals in the city from unreasonable intrusions caused by excessive unnecessary unreasonable or unusually loud noises  it is not the intent or purpose of this section to limit or abridge the rights of any person to peacefully assemble and express opinions and no provision of this section shall be so construed b it shall be unlawful for any person to make continue maintain or cause to be made or continued any excessive unnecessary unreasonable or unusually loud noise or any noise which either annoys disturbs injures or endangers the comfort repose health peace or safety of others within the city c it shall be unlawful for any person to use operate or permit the use or operation of any electronic device radio receiving set television musical instrument phonograph or other machine or device for the producing or reproducing of sound in such manner as to disturb the peace quiet and comfort of the neighboring inhabitants or at any time with louder volume than is necessary for convenient hearing of the person who are in the room vehicle or chamber in which such machine or device is operated and who are voluntary listeners thereto neighboring inhabitants shall include persons living within or occupying residential districts of single or multifamily dwellings and shall include areas where multipleunit dwellings and highdensity residential districts are located d no person shall congregate with other persons because of participate in or being any part or gathering of people from which sound emanates of a sufficient volume so as to disturb the peace quiet or repose of persons residing in any residential area no person shall visit or remain within any residential dwelling unit or within the vicinity of a residential dwelling unit wherein such party or gathering of people is taking place except persons who have gone there for the sole purpose of abating the disturbance a police officer may order all person present in any group or gathering from which such sound emanates other than the owners or tenants of the dwelling unit to immediately disperse in lieu of being charged under this section owners or tenants of the dwelling unit shall immediately abate the disturbance and failing to do so shall be in violation of this section e any person who shall violate the provisions of this section shall upon conviction thereof be fined not more than $10000 or be imprisoned for not more than 30 days or be both so fined and imprisoned    2 curfew hours declared includes the concept of spending time idly  to be dilatory  to linger  to stay  to saunter  to delay  to stand around  and shall also include the colloquial expression hanging around public place means any place to which the general public has access and a right to resort for business entertainment or other lawful purpose but does not necessarily mean a place devoted solely to the uses of the public it shall also include the front or immediate area of any store shop restaurant tavern or other place of business and also public ground areas or parks b it shall be unlawful for any person to loiter loaf wander stand or remain idle either alone and or in consort with others in a public place in such a manner so as to 1 obstruct any public street public highway public sidewalk or any other public place or building or hindering or impeding to tending to hinder or impede the free and uninterrupted passage of vehicles traffic or pedestrians  2 commit in or upon any public street public highway public sidewalk or any other public place or building any act or thing which is an obstruction or interference to the free and uninterrupted use of property or with any business lawfully conducted by anyone in or upon or facing or fronting on any such public street public highway public sidewalk or any other public place or building all of which prevents the free and uninterrupted ingress egress and regress therein thereon and thereto c when any person causes or commits any of the conditions enumerated in subsection a of this section a police officer or any law enforcement officer shall order that person at stop causing or committing such conditions and to move on or disperse any person who fails or refuses to obey such orders shall be guilty of a violation of the provisions of this section d any person who shall violate the provisions of this section shall upon conviction thereof be fined not more than $10000 or imprisoned for not more than 30 days or be both place or at a public meeting except in designated smoking areas 2 smoking areas may be designated by proprietors or other person in charge of public places except in passenger elevators school buses public means of mass transportation and any other place in which smoking is prohibited by the fire marshal or by other law ordinance or regulation 3 where smoking areas are designated existing physical barriers and ventilation shall be used to minimize the toxic effect of smoke in adjacent nonsmoking areas c signs and designated smoking areas  authorizing proprietor or person in charge of public place to establish designated smoking areas the proprietor or other person in charge of the premises of a public place shall post or cause to be posted in a conspicuous place signs clearly stating that smoking is prohibited by state law and by ordinances of the city the person in charge of the premises shall also post or cause to be posted in any designated smoking area signs stating that smoking is permitted in such room or area the proprietor or person in charge of the public place shall have the authority to establish the percentage of area in the public place which shall be provisions and licensing requirements may be revoked    secs 308030101  reserved article iii  wellington lake establishment there is hereby established an area to be known as the wellington lake recreation area located on real estate owned by the city of wellington kansas in sumner county kansas    declaration of policy it is hereby declared to be the policy of the city to provide to the residents of the city and its environs as well as the present water customers of the city a supply of potable water from the waters of wellington lake and at the same time promote the safe and prudent use by the public of the wellington lake recreation area for recreational purposes in a manner compatible with the maintenance of the waters of wellington lake as a municipal water supply    definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning alcoholic liquor means alcohol spirits wine beer and every liquid or solid patented or not containing alcohol spirits wine or beer and capable of being consumed as a beverage by a human being but shall not include any cereal malt beverage bicycle means every device propelled by human power upon which any person may ride having two tandem wheels either of which is more than 14 inches in diameter cereal malt beverage means any fermented but undistilled liquor brewed or made from malt or from a mixture of malt or malt substitute but does not include any such liquor which is more than 32 percent alcohol by weight city means the city of wellington kansas commercial activity means any activity which involves the buying and selling of any goods wares and merchandise or the providing of any service of any nature whatsoever or the renting or leasing boats or other recreational equipment or sporting goods of any sort for a valuable consideration concessionaire means any person firm association or corporation that by written contract with the governing body of the city has been granted the right to conduct a commercial activity in the wellington lake recreation area craft means any boat or vessel designed for use on water household means all members of one family living together at a single residence lake means all waters impounded by the dam located in the wellington lake recreation area motor vehicle means every vehicle other than a motorized bicycle which is selfpropelled motorcycle means every motor vehicle having a seat or saddle for the use of the rider and designed to travel on not more than three wheels in contact with the ground but excluding a tractor motordriven cycle means every motorcycle including every motor scooter with a motor which produces not to exceed five brake horsepower and every bicycle with motor attached nonresident means any person who does not maintain a permanent resident within sumner county kansas officer means any person authorized or designated by the city to enforce all rules and regulations set forth in this article including members of the city police department the county sheriffs department and the state highway patrol as well as any person authorized or designated by the state or the united states government or any agency thereof to enforce any state or federal laws rules or regulations applicable to the wellington lake recreation area or any activities permitted or carried on in the recreation area recreation area supervisor means the person appointed by the city manager to oversee the operation and maintenance of the recreational facilities in the area and the use of the area including the use of the waters of wellington lake for recreational purposes by the public resident means any person who maintains a permanent residence within sumner county kansas roadway means those areas in the recreation area which are specifically designed and improved for vehicular travel vehicle means every device in upon or by which any person or property is or may be transported or drawn upon an highway except devices moved by human power or used exclusively upon stationary rails or tracks    recreation permit a all persons desiring to use the wellington recreation area for any purpose other than for sightseeing and fishing shall first obtain a recreation permit for the persons vehicle from the recreation area supervisor or the recreation area supervisors duly authorized agent and pay the fees established therefore additional permits may be purchased for vehicles owned by members of the same household for the prescribed fees the permit shall be issued for the vehicle owned by the person requesting the permit and stickers showing that a permit has been issued shall be provided for attachment to the vehicle for which the same was issued the permit shall entitle the owner of the vehicle to use the facilities of the recreation area for recreational purposes vehicles entering the recreation area without a permit for any purpose other than sightseeing and fishing shall be in violation of this section and shall be subject to penalties set forth in section 30118 b fees for recreation permits and additional permits are as as set by the governing body and on file in the city clerks office c the fees for permits shall be in addition to fees established in sections 30106 30107h and 30109 for specific activities       i 12162014 boating  rules and regulations  fees a boat operation permitted  exceptions subject to the rules and regulations and upon the payment of boating fees hereinafter set forth the operation of boats on the waters of wellington lake shall be permitted at all times except during those periods of time designated by the state department of wildlife and parks as seasons for the hunting of water fowl and game birds and animals in the county provided however that during such hunting seasons boats propelled only by human power and boats with trolling motors may be used with extreme caution for the purpose of placing or removing decoys and blinds hydroplanes aero propellers and houseboats shall not be permitted on the waters of wellington lake b licenses before any boat shall be operated on the waters of wellington lake a license for such boat shall be obtained from the lake supervisor if the boat to be licensed is a motor boat or a sail powered boat satisfactory evidence that the boat is insured for public liability and property damage with a single limit coverage of not less than $2500000 shall be furnished the lake supervisor before a license is issued no license shall be issued unless the appropriate fee as hereinafter set forth has been collected by the lake supervisor c hours no boats except fishing boats being operated at a speed that produces no visible wake shall be operated on the waters of wellington lake between onehalf hour after sunset and onehalf hour before sunrise d launching motorboats shall be launched on and removed from the waters of wellington lake only at designated launching areas small human powered boats may be launched where convenient e life jackets approved life jackets sufficient in number to supply one jacket to each occupant of the boat shall be carried on all boats persons 12 years of age and under shall actually wear an approved life jacket at all times such person is on a boat f traffic boats shall travel in a generally counterclockwise direction on the waters of wellington lake  boats shall turn to the right when meeting another boat  when overtaking another boat the overtaking boats shall turn to the left  boats approaching each other at right angles shall give the rightofway to the boat on the right  motor powered boats shall at all times give the rightofway to sailboats and human powered boats g rough waters notwithstanding contrary language in this article no person shall operate a boat on the waters of wellington lake when the waters of the lake are sufficiently rough to be considered dangerous h swimming no boat shall proceed into any area of the waters of wellington lake which is designated and marked as a swimming area i boat trailers boat trailers shall be parked only in this area of the wellington lake recreation area as are specifically designated and marked for boat trailer parking j transporation for hire no person other than a duly authorized concessionaire shall carry or transport any person upon the waters of wellington lake for hire or for any valuable consideration whatsoever k duty to render assistance all owners andor operators of boats on the waters wellington lake shall render assistance at times of emergency and in the enforcement of these rules and regulations when called upon by the recreation area supervisor or the recreation area supervisors duly authorized representative l boat docks boat docks are provided on wellington lake for the purpose of loading and unloading onto and from boats and no privately owned boat docks shall be constructed or maintained on the waters of wellington lake m water skiing water skiing shall be permitted on the waters of wellington lake in those areas designated for water skiing  when meeting or passing other boats skiers shall take and maintain a position behind the skiers towing boat until the other boat is safely passed  skiers shall be retrieved from the water as soon as possible after the skier falls from the skis into the water  no boat shall be operated with ski lines behind the boat unless a skier is being towed or retrieved from the water water skiers shall wear approved ski vests n boat fees boat fees shall be as set by the governing body and on file in the city clerks office such fees which shall be in addition to fees charged for a recreation permit shall be charged for boating on the waters of wellington lake except for boats used only for fishing purposes       i 12162014 camping  rules and regulations  fees a camping shall be permitted in those parts of the wellington lake recreation area which are designed marked and posted for camping and in no other parts of the recreation area by any person who holds a valid recreation permit for the wellington recreation area primitive camping will be permitted in areas designated therefore but will not be permitted in camping areas served by electricity such camping shall be in conformity with the camping fees hereinafter specified no advance reservations will be made for the utilization of any camping area provided with electrical drops or hookups b any person desiring to set up camp shall first pay the lake supervisor the appropriate camping fee in accordance with the schedule of fees hereinafter set forth and obtain from the supervisor the assignment of a camp site location and number and the camper shall use the assigned site and no other site c no camper or other person shall make any connection to water outlets in the wellington recreation area for a period longer than necessary to fill water tanks or storage facilities on a trailer mobile home camper or recreational vehicle d only vehicles using electrical outlets provided for campers shall be parked near such outlets any other vehicles parked near said electric outlets will be required to pay camping fees for the additional vehicle no 30 amp electrical adapters shall be plugged into or used in 15 amp outlets e shelter houses in the wellington lake recreation area shall not be used for camping nor shall any electric outlets in said shelter houses be used to supply electrical power to trailers mobile homes campers trailers or other recreational vehicles f no trailer mobile home camper or other recreation vehicle shall be parked in boat ramp areas in the wellington lake recreation area g during cold weather public restrooms in the recreation area will be closed and will not be available for use by campers  campers using the recreation area during time when the public restrooms are closed must provide or make provision for their own restroom facilities h camping fees the fees shall be as set by the governing body and on file in the city clerks office such fees which shall be in addition to fees charged for a recreation permit shall be charged for camping in the wellington lake recreation area i camping in the wellington lake recreation area between the first day of waterfowl season each year and the following march 1 shall be allowed only in the area designated as old west      241997  i 12182001  i 12162014  i 1212015 fishing  rules and regulations a fishing shall be permitted in the waters of wellington lake by all persons those who are required to hold a valid fishing license issued by the state must do so no unattended fishing lines including drop lines may be used between sunrise and sunset and no trout lines or link lines may be used at any time b to ensure quality fishing in the waters of wellington lake in the future the size and possession limits of fish taken shall be as provided by state law c    i 541999   hunting  rules and regulations  fees a the hunting of water fowl in the wellington lake recreation area shall be permitted during seasons established by the state for the hunting of waterfowl in the county and at no other time the hunting of upland game birds furbearing animals deer and predatory animals as well as the trapping of furbearing animals in the recreation area is at all times prohibited b the display or discharge of firearms in the wellington lake recreation area except during a stateestablished waterfowl season is prohibited c those persons who are required to hold a valid hunting license issued by the state must also hold a valid wellington recreation area waterfowl hunting permit and all persons must hold a valid recreation permit for the wellington lake recreation area d the fees shall be as set by the governing body and on file in the city clerks office upon the payment of the fees and the showing by the hunter that if required holds a valid hunting license issued by the state and such waterfowl stamps as are required by the state and the government of the united states the recreation area supervisor or the recreation area supervisors duly authorized agent shall issue to the hunter a license to hunt waterfowl in the recreation area in accordance with the rules and regulations in this article     i 12162014 picnicking  use of shelter houses a picnicking shall be permitted in all areas of the wellington lake recreation area with purchase of the recreation permit which are safe and suitable for that purpose and in shelter houses therein located  picnic tables and shelter houses in the area are available for use on a first come first served basis and no advance reservations shall be made for the utilization of the same except large rock shelter located at eagle cove all picnickers shall be responsible for the policing of the picnic area or shelter they have used to see that all food waste paper paper cups dishes and other utensils and containers used is property disposed of and the area left in a neat and orderly condition for the next user b shelter houses are not to be used for camping of any kind whatsoever nor shall campers use electrical outlets at shelter houses in connection with camping activities    swimming a swimming will be permitted in the swimming beach area of the waters of wellington lake located in the southwest corner of the lake and marked by buoys establishing in the limits of the swimming area  when buoys are not in place no swimming will be permitted  swimming may be restricted when in the opinion of the recreation area supervisor the waters of lake wellington are for any reason unsafe for swimmers  a recreation permit shall be required for swimming b no lifeguards will be provided in the swimming area and swimmer will assume all risks of injury which may result from such swimming  children under the age of 12 years must be accompanied by an adult  no glass alcoholic liquor or cereal malt beverages or dogs will be permitted in the swimming beach area  the area shall be closed from onehalf hour after sunset to onehalf hour before sunrise    archery the sport of archery whether for purposes of practice or archery competition or otherwise shall not be permitted in the wellington lake recreation area without specific written authority from the city such authority shall not be granted unless adequate insurance coverage is provided to protect the city as well as others using the recreation area and surrounding territory against personal injury and property damage resulting from shooting bows and arrows each participant in the sport agrees in writing to abide by and comply with all rules regulations and requirements set forth in this article and in the written document granting such authority and unless the city park board recommends that such authority be granted    commercial activities commercial activities may be carried on in the wellington lake recreation area only by persons who have by written agreement with the city obtained approval to carry on such activity    special events the governing body of the city may at any time permit especial events at the wellington lake recreation area by large groups or by the community as a whole and to close such parts of the recreation area for such period of time as deemed necessary to accommodate such special event a special event for purposes of this section shall be deemed to be an event which occurs or is held not more frequently than once a year and which extends for no longer than two consecutive days and in which an unusually large number of persons would participate    rights reserved by city because the waters of wellington lake serve as the water supply for residents of the city and its environs as well as for several rural water districts the city shall have the right notwithstanding any language herein that may be construed to the contrary at any time to change amend repeal or suspend for any period of time recreational privileges granted by this article in order to protect such water supply for human consumption and such action by the city may be taken without any requirement that permit and license fees collected under the provisions of this article be refunded to the person from whom such fees were collected    acts prohibited it shall be unlawful for any person to do any of the following acts in the wellington lake recreation area 1 to sell there is hereby created and established pursuant to ksa supp 121118 a fund of the city to be known as the golf course capital improvement reserve fund which fund shall be used for the purpose of financing in whole or in part any public improvement need for the golf course including the repair restoration and rehabilitation of existing facilities    use it is declared to be the policy of the governing body of the city that the golf course capital improvement reserve fund shall be used as a financing mechanism for repair reconstruction and rehabilitation of public facilities for the improvement of the golf course department of the city the amount to be annually reserved shall be to the maximum extent possible to meet the citys present and future public infrastructure needs in the golf course and to avoid cost of unnecessary indebtedness and to annually approve in the future of the budgeting of an amount sufficient to finance repairs maintenance or construction of facilities 3066630668 3069530697 3072330725 and enacted a new art viii as set out herein the former art viii pertained to similar subject definitions definitions in this section shall only apply in burial or interment shall be defined as the interring of a body or cremated remains of a single person in the ground or above ground in a mausoleum or columbarium this shall also include synonyms or similar words describing the placing of human cremains in a columbarium niche disinterment shall be defined as the removing of a body or cremated remains of a single person from the ground or above ground in remains from a niche foot marker shall be defined as any permanent monuments or marker placed at the foot of the grave headstone shall be defined as any permanent monuments or markers placed at the prairie lawn cemetery shall not project more than six inches above the surface of the ground and all other permanent monuments or markers on lots 1 to 8 inclusive shall be flush with the ground surface b headstones on lots 9 to 16 inclusive in blocks 10661077  11111122  11561167  inclusive in prairie lawn cemetery may project more than six inches above the surface of the ground and all other permanent monuments or markers on said lots 9 to 16 inclusive shall be flush with the ground surface c all headstones shall have a concrete foundation extending at least six inches beyond the sides and ends of the monument or marker the foundation shall be reinforced with not less than threeeighths inch reinforcing bars spaced not less than six inches apart on center and extending the full length of the foundation to a point three inches from each end of the foundation and be set in conformity with the following rules 1 headstones up to 12 inches in height not including the base shall have a concrete foundation six inches deep precast foundations may be used providing they meet or exceed specifications and must have a smooth finish 2 headstones up to 24 inches in height not including the base shall have a concrete foundation six inches deep with not less than four concrete piers of a diameter of not less than six inches extending twelve inches below the bottom of the concrete foundation precast foundations may be used providing they meet or exceed specifications and must have a smooth finish 3 headstones up to 36 inches in height not including the base shall have a concrete foundation eight inches deep with not less than six concrete piers of a diameter of not less than six inches extending 12 inches below the bottom on the concrete foundation 4 headstones up to 48 inches in height not including the base shall have a concrete foundation 12 inches deep with not less than six concrete piers of a diameter of not less than six inches extending 24 inches below the bottom of the concrete foundation 5 the foundation of any monument or marker exceeding 48 inches in height not including the base shall be determined on an individual basis 6 the top surface of all concrete foundations shall be flush with the ground surface adjacent to the foundation 7 foot markers shall be set flush with the ground and shall have a concrete foundation not less than sixinches deep which shall extend at least sixinches beyond the sides and ends of the foot marker reinforced with not less than threeeighths inch reinforcing bars set around the perimeter of the foot marker and may be precast 8 foundations for aboveground mausoleums will be determined for each individual situation 9 if it is necessary to move and reset a stone to accommodate an individual burial on a grave the funeral home shall be responsible therefor 10 no dry mix shall be allowed in the pouring of foundations all foundations must be wet poured unless otherwise noted 11 all vases set at ground level must have concrete extending six inches beyond the vase on all sides 12 vases will not be allowed on flush footmarkers d all monuments and markers shall be constructed of marble bronze or granite e all monuments or markers in block 1090 baby land shall be set flush with the ground and shall have a concrete foundation six inches deep and shall have a monument or marker measuring no longer than 17 by nine inches with a concrete foundation measuring 24 by 15 inches and must be precast f all monuments and decorations that are above ground level must go at the head of the grave g no monuments or markers may be set one week before memorial day h temporary markers shall be left for a period of no longer than one year after the date of the burial or until they are no longer legible or until a permanent marker is set whichever comes first whereupon the sexton shall remove the temporary marker and dispose of it accordingly i the placement of memorial benches statues private columbariums or private mausoleums must be authorized by the public works director and sexton before installation will be allowed j any company setting a monument or marker shall have 14 days from the date the monument or marker foundation was installed to pull forms and backfill k for any burials in the area designated as the veterans monument or marker shall be limited to a veterans administration marker and be limited to a single marker placed at the head of the grave l lot owners may have the corners of the lots they own marked with a granite bronze or marble corner marker no larger than six inches square at the surface and which shall in all cases be set in the ground inside the lot boundaries under the supervision of the sexton so that the same may be flush with the surface of the lot and surrounded by a threeinch concrete apron extending at least two inches below the bottom of the corner marker but not less than four inches in depth m the city reserves the right to require a wet poured foundation     ii 5212019 placement of mausoleums a no mausoleums either surface or above surface may be placed in the new high density section of prairie lawn cemetery the cemetery 7 glass of any kind is a safety hazard and as such is strictly forbidden in the cemetery and any glass that is found will be promptly removed and disposed of     ii 321999  ii 5212019 public improvement need for the department including the repair restoration and rehabilitation of existing facilities     ii 5212019 policy it is declared to be the policy of the governing body of the needs of the cemetery and for repair reconstruction and rehabilitation of public facilities for the improvement of the cemetery department of the city the amount to be annually reserved shall be to the maximum extent possible to meet the citys present and future public infrastructure needs in the cemetery and to avoid cost of unnecessary indebtedness and to annually approve in the future the budgeting of an amount sufficient to finance the acquisition of additional land for future use and for needed repairs maintenance or construction of facilities     ii 5212019 plan the city manager construct maintain and keep in repair to their full width all crossings over all streets alleys and ditches used by them to construct and maintain drains and culverts where crossed by any line of the railroad over all streets or alleys over which they run and to comply with orders of the governing body of the city directing the laying and construction of railroad tracks turnouts or switches and to regulate the grade of the same and requiring all such companies to conform to the grade of the streets and alleys of the city as they are now or hereafter may be established such crossing shall be constructed maintained and repaired in accordance with specifications now on file in the department of engineering    service of notice to comply a railroad company that has constructed or is not maintaining a railroad crossing in a manner that is in compliance with the requirements set forth in section 32110 or is not otherwise complying with the requirements therein contained may be served with notice to comply by the city serving written notice of such noncompliance upon the resident agent of the railroad company such written notice shall identify the location of the crossing or other condition that does not comply with the requirements and such notice shall specify the condition that needs to be corrected to bring such crossing or condition into compliance    penalty any railroad company after it has been served with a notice as provided in section 32111 to construct or maintain suitable grade crossings or other improvements in compliance with section 32111 at or over its maintenance or correction within 90 days after the service of such notice upon said railroad company or thereafter fails neglects or refuses to complete the same within 180 days after service of such notice upon said railroad company shall upon conviction thereof be fined $10000 each day that any violation of section 32111 this section or both continues shall constitute a separate offense and
